tweet: We are going to need an army of people to help with contact tracing and quaratining over the next few years. This week I introduced a bill that will use existing relationships with organizations like AmeriCorps and build on them.  #Stand4Service

I am excited about my "Farmers Feeding Families Act" that I have introduced with @cathymcmorris and @SenBobCasey. It will connect small and medium-sized farmers who have surplus products and food banks that are seeing unprecedented need to keep our communities fed and healthy.

The "PPP and Healthcare Enhancement Act" that the House passed last month included small business assistance for farms. Starting today, farmers and agribusiness owners can now apply for assistance. https://t.co/wyraEqSPIe
On Friday I joined @KOHO101 to talk about what I am working on in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Listen here: https://t.co/WvwwnCmFZU

May 1st is also known as #InternationalWorkersDay. This crisis is showing just how important workers are to keeping our economy strong. Especially right now, I stand with frontline workers who are putting a lot on the line to keep us safe and healthy. https://t.co/cX73MbixBC

We've been hearing a lot about "reopening the economy." Many of my constituents have asked me when that will happen. As a doctor and Congresswoman, here's what I think "reopening" will look like & what needs to happen to get us there: https://t.co/rKIoPQNYWF

This #WorldImmunizationWeek I am particularly concerned about the children who are missing out on life-saving #vaccines because of the coronavirus pandemic. Now more than ever, we must invest in public health systems to make sure they are resilient, even to global pandemics.

This week @PattyMurray and I led the WA Dem delegation members in sending a letter to @VP Pence asking the Administration to implement a comprehensive national testing plan. We cannot restart the economy without more testing. This needs to happen now! https://t.co/CISrIrgHZx
Today at 3pm PDT, @RepDerekKilmer and I will be answering your questions over on Facebook Live about the COVID-19 pandemic and how Congress has responded. Tune in! https://t.co/yygmnMsyc0

Today I spoke with U.S. Ag Secretary Perdue and advocated for WA state’s farmers and growers. Our farm families are facing a multitude of challenges right now. I specifically brought up H2A visas and housing, & the implementation of CFAP program and how WA farmers can benefit. https://t.co/l9zwTOb2B3

Last week while I was in DC, I brought constituent concerns to  @HouseSmallBiz about the small business loan programs. Funding we passed last week should be available today. We need to make sure this program is administered fairly and takes care of Main Street businesses. https://t.co/MQ3y8hCqL1

Small businesses in the 8th district are hurting so I was happy to vote for $310 billion more for PPP. The bill also allocates funding for critically-needed testing. We need to be testing 10-20x more than we are right now. Testing is the key to getting back to work. https://t.co/MqnZVkIAy1

Yesterday I held a webinar with @ESDwaWorks to answer questions about their new system and who is eligible. I know this process has been frustrating for many of you, so I'm glad we were able to get answers to some common questions. You can watch here: https://t.co/qEn4LxBTbl

Washingtonians are blessed to have so many beautiful natural treasures in our state. On the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay, we must ensure that our planet and all of its natural treasures are protected for our children and generations we will never know.

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we must remember that intolerance, xenophobia, and scapegoating were the seeds that allowed the Holocaust to take root. Let’s learn from history so we can honestly say “Never again.”

Businesses need money now. We need the Paycheck Protection Program to work the way it was intended. To all of my fellow doctors who now find themselves on the frontline of this pandemic, on behalf of the 8th District, I want to say thank you for your work keeping us safe and healthy during this uncertain time! #NationalDoctorsDay

Hospitals in some areas are being overwhelmed with COVID-19 patients, and because of a lack of PPE, some COVID-19 patients with diabetes are not having blood sugars adequately checked or managed. 1/2
